Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare whether an applicant (details supplied) in County Galway is eligible for dental benefit.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond) Barry Desmond
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Social Welfare (Mr. B. Desmond)
Speaker.P: In order to qualify for dental benefit a claimant must satisfy certain contribution conditions, one of which requires persons over 23 years of age to have not less than 156 reckonable contributions paid at the date of the claim. The person concerned claimed dental benefit on 28 October 1982. According to the records of the Department only 97 reckonable contributions were paid on his behalf up to the end of the 1981-82 contribution year. From inquiries made it was established that he had no earlier employment and that a further 48 contributions were paid in the 1982-83 contribution year giving him a total of 145 contributions. The claim could not therefore be approved as the contribution conditions were not satisfied. The claimant and his dentist were notified on 26 April 1983.

When the claimant has 11 contributions paid in the current contribution year he will be qualified for dental benefit and should submit a further claim in respect of any treatment required after that date.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Walsh Mr. J. Walsh
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will sanction the commencement of work on a new national school for Bandon, County Cork; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Title documents submitted in respect of the site offered for a new primary school in Bandon, County Cork, are being examined by the Chief State Solicitor. When satisfactory title has been established a grant towards the cost of the project will be sanctioned.
At this early stage of planning, it is not possible to state when building work may commence.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Byrne Mr. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when an extension to Bree national school, County Wexford will be built.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The board of management has been authorised to employ an architect to prepare sketch plans for the proposed extension to Bree national school, County Wexford. The submission of these plans is awaited.
It is not possible to state when building work may commence.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Wexford School Absenteeism.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Byrne Mr. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will give details of the amount of absenteeism in second-level schools in County Wexford since 9 May 1983; and the comparable figure for 1982.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The statistical information requested by the Deputy is not available.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will consider a proposal to set up a residential school for deaf children in County Kerry in view of the fact that it is most unsatisfactory for these children to attend school in either Cork or Dublin at present; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: Representations have been made to me recently regarding the proposed establishment of a day facility for hearing impaired pupils in County Kerry. I am arranging a meeting between officers of my Department and representatives of the parents in question for the purpose of a discussion of the representations.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education her plans for the provision of a water supply for Annabla national school, Kilcummin, Killarney, County Kerry.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: No application has been received in my Department from the authorities of Annabla national school, County Kerry, for the provision of a water supply at the school.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Dea Mr. O'Dea
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the status the course in rural and general science introduced by Thomond College of Education, Limerick in 1979 will have; if she is aware that students who enrolled in 1979 were led to believe that they would qualify for a B. Sc. degree; if she will take appropriate steps to ensure that these students have not been misled; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The first group of graduate teachers of general and rural science, who entered the college in 1979, are due to graduate from Thomond College of Education, Limerick in 1983, and successful graduates will be awarded a Bachelor of Arts Degree by the National Council for Educational Awards.

I am not aware that students were led to believe that they would qualify for a Bachelor of Science Degree on completion of the course. I understand from the college authorities that the course was not advertised at any stage as a B.Sc. course.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Institute for Higher Education Course.

Speaker.hpid: Miss Flaherty Miss Flaherty
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will give details of the grants payable to students in our Institute for Higher Education who are paying fees to the relevant Irish institute but where the course demands attendance at a foreign university; and if she will agree to the payment of a maintenance grant in all of these cases.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The arrangements in connection with the relevant courses were made by the National Institute of Higher Education, Dublin and set out in the published prospectus.
The arrangements do not involve additional expenditure by the institute in respect of the period of the students' attendance at the specified continental university or institute of higher education.

MainHeading.P: If, however, the student is in receipt of a higher education grant in accordance with the terms of a scheme formulated under the Local Authorities (Higher Education Grants) Act, the grant in respect of maintenance may be paid in all cases at the appropriate non-adjacent rate in respect of the period of study at the educational institution abroad.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Moynihan Mr. Moynihan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if free school transport will be given to the children of a person (details supplied) in County Cork who are attending secondary schools in Bandon and are sitting for examinations.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. Hussey) Gemma Hussey
Speaker.P: The pupils concerned were issued with tickets for school transport to Bandon on 18 May 1983.
